intro: Xanthocromyon herbertii, commonly known as Herbert's goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Xanthocromyon herbertii is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
